peril.views.slick.states

Class PlayerSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState
      • peril.views.slick.states.InteractiveState
        • peril.views.slick.states.PlayerSelection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.newdawn.slick.ControlledInputReciever, org.newdawn.slick.ControllerListener, org.newdawn.slick.InputListener, org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener, org.newdawn.slick.MouseListener, org.newdawn.slick.state.GameState, Container

    public final class PlayerSelection
extends InteractiveState
    The InteractiveState that allows the user to select the number of SlickPlayers and the AI that control those SlickPlayers. The user may also select the the speed of the AIs.
    Since:
    2018-03-16
    Version:
    1.01.11
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy, Gurdeep_Pol, Ezekiel_Trinidad
    See Also:
    InteractiveState, AI, MainMenu

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  PlayerSelection.Player
      Encapsulates the details about a player that is displayed on the PlayerSelection screen.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String AI_TEXT
      The text before the name of the AI.
      private VisualList<AI> aiList
      The VisualList containing all the AIs in the game.
      private VisualList<java.lang.Integer> aiSpeeds
      The VisualList containing the different AI speeds available for the user to select.
      private int height
      The height of the map that the page will load after the players have been set.
      private static java.lang.String NAME
      The name of this PlayerSelection.
      private VisualList<java.lang.Integer> numberOfPlayers
      The VisualList of the number of SlickPlayers that can be in the game.
      private java.util.List<PlayerSelection.Player> players
      The List of PlayerSelection.Players that will be used to construct the game.
      private VisualList<java.lang.Boolean> randomOrderToggle
      A VisualList containing Boolean values that will enable or disable the random PlayerSelection.Player order.
      private PlayerSelection.Player selected
      The PlayerSelection.Player that the user is currently selecting an AI for.
      private Font textFont
      The Font used to display text on the PlayerSelection screen.
      private Point topPlayer
      The Point position of the top player on the screen.
      private int width
      The width of the map that the page will load after the players have been set.

        The List of PlayerSelection.Players that will be used to construct the game.

        private final Point topPlayer
        The Point position of the top player on the screen. All the other players will be displayed below this position.
